attributes.action: Bring an end to zero hour contracts!
attributes.background: Zero hour contracts make it hard for people to save and budget. This can cause a host to many detrimental effects! Under a zero hour contract an employer has no obligation to provide any minimum hours of work leaving employees with worry that they may not be able to feed their family or pay bills.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero hour contracts make it hard for people to save and budget. This can cause a host to many detrimental effects! Under a zero hour contract an employer has no obligation to provide any minimum hours of work leaving employees with worry that they may not be able to feed their family or pay bills on time. 
I would like Parliament to discuss bringing a minimum guaranteed hours scheme or a base pay so people don't have to rely on benefits to see them through.

attributes.action: Call for Government to fund rural school transport
attributes.background: we call for the government to fund all rural home to school transport across the country instead of local councils being responsible for setting their own privatized school bus services, which is causing financial hardship to working families, and severe disruption to public services.
attributes.additional_details: local councils have been given responsibility for setting school bus services, which has allowed them to privatize the bus routes and hike up the prices to almost £1000 per child,per year in some cases. This is causing severe financial hardship to low income families who do not qualify now under the new 'nearest school' changes, as opposed to the old 'catchment school' agreement.we would like all children to travel to school for free, all current school bus services also need improvement.

attributes.action: Cut the NHS waiting list for military children when moving.
attributes.background:
My husband is in the military and we found out 2/3 of our children have SEN meaning they need services provided by NHS.

 we waited over a year for services, we finally get seen to then only get posted. We find out this means we go to the bottom of any list! Starting the process all over again.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm calling on the government to bring in a legislation that serving millitary families do NOT go to the bottom of the NHS waiting lists when they move. 
by the time you get the service you NEED you then get a posting order to only start the process again, meaning your at the bottom of the list! Meanwhile it has had a detremental effect in their development.

put something into place to protect them.  Our families already sacrifice so much, yet recive no support in this matter which is needed.

attributes.action: Free sun cream for all school children
attributes.background: I have been recently been diagnosed with skin cancer, being only 28 this has come as a bit of a shock. being a red head, fair skinned , and freckly I always kept an eye on skin changes but you still think it wont happen to you. This then flagged up and made me take notice the price of sun cream.
attributes.additional_details:
Every child should have access to sun cream, especially march-October, teachers, anybody in a position of care to a child should be allowed to apply sun cream where they see fit.
Sun damage ages the skin but also raises the risk of skin cancer, one of the most preventable cancer. I believe all school children should receive a 'sunstart' pack containing a sun hat, sun cream, and information sheet, a bottle of water , and an activity pack. FREE SUN CREAM FOR ALL SCHOOL CHILDREN.

attributes.action: Require a referendum before any decision on the privatisation of public services
attributes.background: In recent times the Post Office has been sold to private ownership and it would seem that the NHS is being sold in small increments currently. All of this happens without the confirmation of the UK voting population. A referendum would, at the least, raise a large amount of awareness to the public.

attributes.action: Stop Evelyn Woods being deported I
attributes.background: Evelyn Woods has lived in Medway 50+ years. Evelyn has had her 3 children born here(unfortunately one past away in 2003) was married and widowed here. This problem came to light when Evelyn got a job,after 3 months was told she couldn't work here and was facing deportation.
attributes.additional_details: Kent online have recently interviews Evelyn and Kelly Tolhurst Mp has been liasioning with the home office.

attributes.action: Call on Government to commission an independent technical review of HS2
attributes.background:
HS2 cannot meet its stated objective of delivering “..hugely enhanced capacity and connectivity between our major conurbations”. 

We call on HM Government to commission an independent technical review of every aspect of the HS2 scheme to determine how and why this failure has happened.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 is an ill-conceived and fundamentally flawed design for a high speed rail line linking London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Originally costed at £30 billion, it is now estimated to cost £56 billion or more. The project is highly controversial because of HS2 Ltd’s failure to evaluate cheaper & better alternatives, its exorbitant cost, insufficient new capacity, poor connectivity, demolition of 500+ homes, serious damage to the Chilterns AONB & Ancient Woodlands and failure to reduce CO2

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists under the age of 16 to wear a helmet
attributes.background:
If you ride a bicycle, you should wear a cycle helmet, it's common sense.
Sadly so many children ride on the road without one.
Many serious accidents that occur would be less serious if the child was wearing a cycle helmet.
Cycle helmets are not expensive but they save lives.
attributes.additional_details: Government figures show 16,727 children under the age of 16 were injured on the roads in 2014, a rise of 6.2 per cent compared to the 15,756 injured in 2013.

attributes.action: Delay invoking Article 50 until Expert Commission reviews impact of Brexit on UK
attributes.background: MPs should respect the wishes of the 63% of the electorate who did not vote to leave the EU, and demand that Article 50 not be invoked until Brexit proponents provide a fully developed plan for the process of leaving the EU, followed by an Expert Commission to assess its economic and social impact.
attributes.additional_details: "Leave campaign" MPs claimed that leaving the EU would mean: more money for the NHS; improved job prospects for UK residents through lower immigration; greater economic prosperity through reduced red-tape and renegotiated trading agreements with the EU and the rest of the world. Since the Referendum, these claims have been significantly reduced, and there is no Brexit plan. Parliament now needs to take responsibility to ensure that the outcome is as beneficial as possible for the British people.

attributes.action: Legalise conjugal visits in UK prisons.
attributes.background: This aims to prompt the introduction of conjugal visits for the 85,998 prisoners in HMPs across the UK. Some will be of the view that prisoners should be granted no privileges, but neglect thought of the spouses who endure great heartache, stress and aloneness whilst their partner is incarcerated.
attributes.additional_details:
Science demonstrates the positive effects that would be seen with regards to reduction of violence and aggrevated incidents within then prison. This is highlighted in hundreds of psychological and scientific case studies.

Not only is a prisoner's own life severely impacted but also their spouses', who have to hold everything together in their partners absence. Spouses did not commit a crime yet bare huge burdens, without the ability to maintain a physical connection with their partner.

attributes.action: Integrate economics and politics classes into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: The reaction of many regretful voters on social media to the post-publication by tabloids of the effects of a 'leave' vote following the EU referendum underlines the need for students of all backgrounds to receive an unbiased but informed education on the important subjects of politics and economics
attributes.additional_details: Please don't let voters continue to engage in guesswork or be swayed by hysteria or bad politics when it comes to their voting preferences. Give our future generations the opportunity to learn about the intricacies of politics, what the major political parties stand for through examination of their manifestos. Show them that these manifestos are rarely manifested. Show them that politics is fraught with lies and, more importantly, how to wade through these lies and make an informed choice.

attributes.action: Reduce the women's retirement age back to 60.
attributes.background: Women work hard within the workplace and having to work many extra hours at home.

attributes.action: British servicemen and women to have legal immunity from prosecution
attributes.background: Financial interests have caused accusations too be made too Service Persons for doing their duty, by order, refusal could mean Mutiny or Treason
attributes.additional_details:
Many enemies use Children and Women as a fire wall, making a problem for every commander, but the active service person should never be held responsible for collateral, nor for that (Drone Pilots)
No service person doing his duty in a war or warlike situation should ever be criminalised for serving His or Her, Queen, Her Country, and Subjects. Ireland, Irak, Afgahnistan  are examples of what can happen.

attributes.action: Ban fire works restrict sales to 48 hours prior to bonfire night
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of fire works until 48 hours prior to an event, create a new law to controll fireworks the current noise and curfews do nothong 
Animal cruelty should should be a number one concern
attributes.additional_details: Just Google the effect on animals it's all there

attributes.action: An URGENT review of the rates Local Authorities pay for adult residential care.
attributes.background: Adult social care is severely under funded. Local authority net spending on social care has dropped by an average of 2.2% a year since 2009 despite day to day living costs increasing. The rates provided to operators to care for LA funded residents are woefully inadequate & many homes risk closure.
attributes.additional_details:
This recent BBC report shows that 5000 care homes in the UK are now on the brink of closure. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36200855

Whilst councils are undoubtedly under extreme financial pressure, in failing to keep up with the rising costs of care, they are putting businesses, jobs & the lives of the UK's most vulnerable residents at risk!

We therefore ask you to review the rates paid by local authorities for adult residential care in the UK as a matter of urgency, before it is too late!

attributes.action: Reveal how many detainees reported being sexually assaulted/raped in Yarl’s Wood
attributes.background: In response to a Freedom of Information request, The Home Office refused to reveal how many detainees have been sexually assaulted or raped inside Yarl’s Wood on the grounds that “disclosure would, or would be likely to, prejudice the commercial interests” of people involved with running Yarl’s Wood
attributes.additional_details:
The Independent submitted the FOI because many reports of sexual assault & abuse have been made against staff at Yarl’s Wood. Chief prisons inspector Nick Hardwick called the centre  a “place of national concern”. The UN’s special rapporteur on violence against women, Rashida Manjoo said she'd been refused entry to the centre by the Government
The Immigration Minister & Home Secretary must reveal the numbers, & stop putting the commercial interests of Serco above human rights of vulnerable people

attributes.action: Rename Manchester Victoria railway station Manchester Victoria Wood station.
attributes.background: Victoria Wood was a much loved comedian born and raised in Manchester. Her humour was distinctive to the city and she set her TV series 'Dinner Ladies' there. Following her death in 2016, Manchester Victoria railway station was renamed in her honour for an hour. It should be renamed permanently.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/whats-on-news/victoria-station-become-victoria-wood-11404138

attributes.action: Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
attributes.background:
Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
Current law states you can only listen to transmissions meant for general reception. This means the general public can not listen to ATC traffic in the UK (but can listen to ATC in the US!).
attributes.additional_details:
A licence is not required for a radio receiver as long as it is not capable of transmission as well (The Wireless Telegraphy Apparatus (Receivers) (Exemption) Regulations 1989 (SI 1989 No 123).

Although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning or other receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant for GENERAL RECEPTION. 
It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so.

attributes.action: Make stillbirth training mandatory for student midwifes before work placements
attributes.background: Many midwifes end up going out onto placement in hospitals without any experience or knowledge in how to deal with the emotional effects of stillbirth on parents. By making stillbirth training mandatory it will improve services provided to the parents they are dealing with in maternity wards.

attributes.action: Equality for mental health
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, have joined together to mount a campaign aimed at persuading the Government to help reduce the suffering of those with mental ill health by increasing investment into the provision of mental health services.
attributes.additional_details:
As ministers make final decisions on the Spending Review, we urge them to treat mental health equally with physical health. We ask for the same right to timely access to evidence based treatment as those with physical health problems.

We accept, this will require additional investment in mental health services. But we are strongly persuaded that investment in mental health services will lead to significant returns by reducing the burden on the NHS through the improved wellbeing of our citizens.

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: Parents must be allowed access to their children unless a court rules otherwise.
attributes.background:
This petition is asking for it to be made illegal for one parent to deny the other access, without them being ruled as unfit by a court. 
 
 This petition is designed to protect children from the emotional damage that occurs when parents use them as a weapon against each other.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities can't make one parent allow the other access. The time it takes for one parent to regain access via the courts can leave lasting damage between a parent and child, who have then lost valuable time during crucial developmental stages, which can never be reclaimed. Unless there is good reason, such as the police suspecting physical abuse, then contact should not be denied, and the local authorities should have the power to ensure access is arranged by law, even if it's supervised

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for doctors to send males letters about a PSA BLOOD TEST
attributes.background: I want action as i find women get reminders to have regular smear tests done but males who are reaching the age of 50 have to ask to have a psa test done to check for prostate cancer and not alot of men know about this test

attributes.action: Provide immediately  £1.5m to replace Deerness Bridge on C18 in County Durham
attributes.background:
This bridge is a vital semi rural link for families and businesses in County Durham. It is now unsafe for use as the replacement of this 114 year old bridge was hindered by County Durham Councils lack of strategy and funding
These lack of funds will delay replacement by more than 1 year by DCC
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.durhamadvertiser.co.uk/news/14501015.Anger_over_one_way_system_following_closure_of_Deerness_Bridge/?ref=rss&utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=facebook

Facebook page : Deerness Bridge action group

attributes.action: maternity to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 85-95
attributes.background: If a minimum sallary is £1200 a month it is impossible to survive with £500 a month in maternity period. The private rent is so expensive not to mention utilities and food, the maternity should be paid for 1 year like other countries and with a % of 85-95 of the sallary.

attributes.action: Control the population of seabirds for health, safety and environmental reasons
attributes.background: The Scarborough News is campaigning for a change in the law to manage the populations of seabirds including kittiwakes in the interest of public safety, health and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of control over the seabird population has led to dangerous food-grabbing swoops on men, women and children, and the creation of a serious scale of mess and stench of droppings in shopping areas, and on pavements, shop buildings and the general environment.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on key Brexit deals BEFORE giving Article 50 notice
attributes.background: There is no democracy without informed consent. Voters did not know before 23 June the terms on which we would leave the EU, the global trade deals which would be done or our immigration policy following Brexit. These must be agreed and voted on BEFORE we give irrevocable Art 50 notice to leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 50 is a one way street.  Once it gives one, that state must leave the EU after 2 years (or more if the remaining 27 agree).  We do not need to give notice until we KNOW that the terms we would have (both with the EU and the rest of the world) would be better outside than inside the EU.

We should promptly negotiate with the EU and others and put these deals to the electorate.  Only if the electorate votes in favour should we leave.  A statute should stop notice being given otherwise.

attributes.action: Demand MPs to hold an anonymous poll on the EU Referendum (Stay/Leave)
attributes.background: MPs need to have their say on the EU Referendum led by their conscience to do the best for Britain. First, it is better to hold an anonymous poll so that MPs are not influenced by career ambitions of being re-elected (support their electoral area outcome even if they are fundamentally against it).
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum had an advisory role. The outcome was compromised by misleading information from the Leave campaign, topics included: NHS, immigration, free movement and the cost of the UK’s EU membership. Millions of people didn't know what they voted for. 
This anonymous poll is designed to help MPs understand where they stand and proceed accordingly as the period of uncertainty is unquestionably bad for the economy.
MPs are required to vote in Britain's best interest by law.

attributes.action: Require Coroners, in suicide cases, to explore if best practice was followed.
attributes.background: Worldwide studies show that the involvement of family, friends & carers helps to reduce suicide. The document, http://bit.ly/1VUKDI5, agreed by all the professional bodies, advocates that unless there are good reasons not to do so, consent should always be sought to involve family, friends & carers.
attributes.additional_details: Rebecca Kelsall, see http://dailym.ai/1UWGJNx, died because GPs failed to follow RCGP guidelines CR152 and the NICE guidelines CG90 and CG91. This showed that the health service can be slow in keeping abreast with latest guidelines. As coroners have a duty to investigate whether death was avoidable, they are best placed to monitor whether best practice guidelines are followed.  As such, coroners should persistently ask clinicians and others for reports about processes and procedures followed.

attributes.action: Create a specific offence to protect Nurses, Paramedics & Medical volunteers.
attributes.background:
This offence should be created to enable prosecution for anyone who assaults Medical Staff. This offence can be committed anywhere medical personnel are working. This must be extended to not only to NHS trusts, but also voluntary organisations and private providers.

Medical Staff are life-savers
attributes.additional_details:
Paramedics have threatened with death, spat at, kicked, punched and had knives pulled on them as they answer emergency calls.

Ambulance trust’s are now calling on magistrates to get tough with offenders convicted of assaulting 999 teams, to protect frontline medics from violence and abuse.

There is no deterrent. If people knew they would get a guaranteed prison sentence for attacking medical staff, they would probably think twice about doing it.

attributes.action: Stop the M56 new junction 11a scheme.
attributes.background: Highways England are planning to introduce a M56 junction 11a. The plans squeeze a new junction between 2 existing junctions that are no more than 4 miles apart. No evidence has been offered by Highways England to justify it's need or cost. It would have a severe impact on several local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Having reviewed the existing plans many residents are sceptical about the motive for this junction. They believe that the new junction would only serve to channel traffic towards a new Mersey Toll Bridge crossing (currently under construction) and will do nothing to ease the serious congestion issues that already exist between Junction 12 and 14.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the dredging of rivers to reduce flooding risk...
attributes.background: The EU directive effectively stopped rivers being dredged causing flash flooding because of the reduced capacity of rivers and their inability to contain run off. Now we are no longer at the behest of the EU we can reintroduce this effective means of flood control...

attributes.action: Make sharing content of disabled children with the intent to humiliate illegal.
attributes.background: The number of hate crime incidences against disabled people are increasing. This is fuelled by sharing disparaging social media content. Disabled children often don't have a voice to defend themselves so should have special protection against behaviour which feeds dangerous negative attitudes.

attributes.action: High sentences on gang bullying
attributes.background: As parents we need the help from the government to reduce the the amount of gang bullying on the streets where there is filming taking place of these children being beaten up for the fun of it. With a strong punishment now in court for this kind of behaviour.

attributes.action: Grant Award winning Palestinian peace activist Iyad Burnat a UK visa!
attributes.background: Iyad Burnat is an award winning peace activist. He has,since 2005, led weekly non-violent protests in his village of Bil'in against the Israeli West Bank barrier. His work as a peace activist has allowed him to travel in the US & Europe & we demand that the UK government grant him a visa.

attributes.action: Make the documents relating to David Kelly's death public
attributes.background:
David Kelly's death, a UN weapons inspector, shortly followed the WMD inspections in 2003. In 2010, the government deemed the circumstances around his death 'should be kept secret' for 70 years.
Following the Chilcot report today, I feel these documents should be released in the public interest.

attributes.action: Official EU Referendum RESULT of LEAVE announced 24TH JUNE 2016 must be CARRIED.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to ENFORCE THE WILL OF THE PEOPLE as decided in the free and democratic EU REFERENDUM VOTE ON 23RD JUNE 2016 and as stated by Prime Minister David Cameron that the Brexit vote was the "will of the British people" and an "instruction which must be delivered"
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister demonstrated his FULL ACCEPTANCE of the result of the EU Referendum on 23rd June 2016, stating that the will of the British people on THAT vote was an instruction that MUST be delivered. This followed his resignation to the Queen, and later to his Government and The Country. 

This EU Referendum gained more votes in total than any General Election in UK history, the LEAVE RESULT also gained more votes than any political party taking office post a General Election. RESULT TO STAND.

attributes.action: Don't leave the EU without guarantees of Vote Leave's promises
attributes.background:
The Vote Leave campaign said the UK could have: 1. £350 million a week back from the EU, for spending on the NHS, 2. Control of migration policy, and 3. Continued access to the single market.
We call on HM Government not to leave the EU without cast-iron guarantees to meet these three key pledges.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that leaders must be accountable, and that promises to voters matter. If and when HM Government invokes Article 50, the UK will have to leave the EU within two years, even if it cannot get a good deal. Any EU country could prevent the UK joining again. We call on HM Government not to leave the EU, and not to invoke article 50, without guarantees that these Vote Leave pledges will be met.

attributes.action: Get Pam Carlson's Deportation OVERTURNED!
attributes.background: Pam has lived in the UK for 7 YEARS, she came over on a Domestic Visa, but split from her long term partner, therefore being deported. She works, lives and contributes to this country as well as being an avid fund raiser for animal charities. She does nothing but GIVE, never taken a penny from theUK
attributes.additional_details: What more information do you need, other than she works, lives, and has a LIFE here in the UK. She fund raises, she helps others, and she is one of the nicest people anyone has ever known.

attributes.action: Remove rail franchise from Southeastern (Govia Ltd)
attributes.background: Southeastern provide a consistent poor service to their customers, causing genuine misery and despair to thousands of commuters in the South East. They put profit before customers and effect the daily lives of people who just want to get to work on time and in comfort. No more debating, take action!

attributes.action: Stop all Funding to the EU
attributes.background: After the referendum result to leave the EU the UK will no longer be involved in decision Making within the EU as such all funding of the EU should cease

attributes.action: Introduce Land Tax or similar reform so super rich can't avoid Inheritance Tax
attributes.background:
PM Mrs May said in her first speech "When it comes to taxes, we’ll prioritise not the wealthy, but you." The new Duke of Westminster, using family trusts, just avoided paying £3.6 BILLION Inheritance Tax.

Land Tax can't be avoided so no one can avoid paying their fair share. Let's make it happen!
attributes.additional_details:
Duke of Westminster avoids billions in inheritance tax:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/tax/inheritance/inheritance-tax-and-how-the-dukes-of-westminster-avoid-it-on-the/

About Land Tax: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/aug/15/queen-duke-westminster-land-value-tax-distribute-wealth-super-rich

The avoided Inheritance Tax could fund the NHS deficit (£2.45 billion) with a billion pounds to spare:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/20/nhs-in-england-reveals-245bn-record-deficit

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap November 2016.
attributes.background: the benefit cap is not being publicised it Will affect thousands of families and children and will leave people 50 pound worse off or more a week it will come directly from your housing benefit and leave people to make up the short fall.This will leave people homeless or not able to pay bills
attributes.additional_details: Please google benefit cap calculator and select November 2016 to see if you are affected

attributes.action: Stop police from passing animal abuse cases to RSPCA for a private prosecution.
attributes.background: This petition is set up to stop UK police forces from passing potential animal abuse cases to the RSPCA for a private prosecution. We strongly believe that if somebody has abused or caused unnecessary suffering to an animal, which is a criminal offence under the animal welfare act 2006,
attributes.additional_details: The police should deal with the case. Such as they do with any other breach of the law. The case should not be passed over to a private charity and become a private case in the eyes of the law.  In recent years there have been many cases were members of the public have had wrongful attempted prosecutions brought upon them. For example, Bob Skinner & Mr Pig in 2015. We believe it is in the best interest of the animals and the public that cases of animal abuse are dealt with by the police from start to finish. Once the case has passed into private hands, what is right and wrong becomes subjective and the lines of the law become blurred, and opinions start to overrule the facts.

attributes.action: Provide much needed Truck Stops on the A34 with modern facilities.
attributes.background: The Haulage Industry carries valuable cargo. The A34 needs dedicated Truck stops with advanced facilities e.g CCTV , shower blocks, healthy food outlets. Laybys have no facilties and are a last resort to HGV drivers.Without HGV's our shops would be empty. Drivers deserve a safe secure resting place.
attributes.additional_details: A34 serves our haulage trade out of one of the UK's leading ports, Southampton.The port handles around 14 million tonnes of cargo and 820,000 vehicles per year.With the port expanding by a third, freight on our roads will increase.Already there is inadequate spaces for HGV to park up on their rest times,this will only get worse.Many HGV drivers experience theft of their cargo and fuel, even at a well known service stations.Current services have not grown with the increase of freight on the road.

attributes.action: KS2 Reading SATs was unfair on pupils & shouldn’t be counted in performance data
attributes.background: Unlike other Key Stage 2 subjects, the Reading paper differed significantly from the sample test. We fully support a drive to increase standards, but the level of vocabulary was above beyond most 11 year olds. This poor communication of expectations by the DfE should not punish pupils or schools.
attributes.additional_details: The number of inferential questions was far higher, with fewer literal, than the sample. Both were inaccessible to lower attainers, who couldn’t show skills learned. In past/sample tests pupils found key words in a question to retrieve information/infer answers. This test required pupils find synonyms of key words. Teachers would have taught this had it been indicated in sample materials/Programme of Study. It’s unfair to test children on skills for which there was no indication to teachers.

attributes.action: Veterans injury compensation to be protected and disregarded for benefits!!
attributes.background:
If a veteran recieves compensation as a result of an injury caused whilst serving our country - i believe it should be protected and disregarded for benefit entitlement.
Recieving compensation shouldn't effect a veteran claiming benefits inc ESA, JSA and housing when they return to civilian life.
attributes.additional_details:
At present compensation is classed as savings. If a veteran recieves over £6,000, their entitlement to benefit may be affected  (reduced). If a veteran recieves more than £16,000 then they may not be entitled to the benefit at all. 

Veterans should be able to choose how they use their compensaton, and not be turned away for benefits and expected to live off it!

Help protect our veterans and their compensaton by signing my petition in support, thankyou :)

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for politicians to lie to the public.
attributes.background: We cannot call ourselves a functioning democracy if our democratic decisions are taken based on lies and deceptions. We therefore demand that any politician who lies to or misleads the public be held legally accountable, and a new agency be set up to monitor political advertising and promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that any politician who lies for personal or political gain should: 
1/ Be removed from their position
2/ Be banned from all public offices for a minimum of ten years
3/ Pay a fine based on the severity of the crime and their ability to pay
Any legislation enacted based on the lie must to be cancelled.
An independent body must be set up to monitor politicians to this effect, and also to monitor political advertising and campaign materials, similarly to the Advertising Standards Agency.

attributes.action: EU citizens to not be allowed to vote in any Scottish independence referendum
attributes.background: EU citzens should not be allowed to vote in future Scottish Referendums it be for Scottish/Scottish living outside Scotland only.

attributes.action: Ask UK Government to Guarantee the UK membership to the European Research Area.
attributes.background: British Universities in particular benefit from participation in European projects. Access to grants and colleagues from across the EU is vital to our universities and our science. We get out more than we put in. Why lose it?
attributes.additional_details:
UK universities in particular benefit hugely from participation in pan European projects and need reassurance from the Government that will continue. Access to the European Research Area is vital to British science and future generations. A recent parliamentary report strongly backed this position. In the future it could be possible for British business to benefit in the same way as universities. 
 
http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201516/ldselect/ldsctech/127/127.pdf
